the TODOs to implement comprehensive tests \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550                          WHAT IS A TEST FILE? \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550 Think of a test file as a quality control inspector in a factory. Just like an inspector checks every product to make sure it works correctly before shipping, our test file checks every function in our smart contract to ensure it behaves exactly as expected. WHY DO WE TEST? 1. **Catch Bugs Before Deployment**: Once a contract is on the blockchain,    you CAN'T change it. A bug in production could mean lost funds forever.    Testing is your safety net. 2. **Document Expected Behavior**: Tests serve as living documentation.    Someone reading your tests can understand exactly what your contract    should do, with concrete examples. 3. **Prevent Regressions**: When you add new features, tests ensure you    didn't accidentally break existing functionality. 4. **Build Confidence**: Good tests let you refactor code fearlessly,    knowing you'll catch any mistakes immediately. \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550                        FOUNDRY TESTING BASICS \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550 Foundry's testing framework follows these conventions: - **Test functions MUST start with \"test\"**: This is how Foundry identifies   which functions to run. `testDeposit()` runs, `checkDeposit()` doesn't. - **setUp() runs before EACH test**: Think of it like resetting the game   board before each round. This ensures every test starts from the same   clean state (isolation!). - **Assertions verify behavior**:   - `assertEq(a, b)`: Check if two values are equal   - `assertTrue(x)`: Check if something is true   - `assertFalse(x)`: Check if something is false   - `vm.expectRevert()`: Check that the next call fails (reverts) - **Cheatcodes control the environment** (vm.*):   - `vm.prank(address)`: Next call pretends to come from that address   - `vm.deal(address, amount)`: Give an address some ETH   - `vm.expectEmit()`: Check that an event was emitted \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550                      HOW TO RUN TESTS \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550 forge test                    # Run all tests forge test -vvv               # Verbose mode - see detailed output forge test --gas-report       # Show gas costs for each function forge test --match-test testDeposit  # Run only tests matching this name forge coverage                # See which lines of code are tested \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550                      THIS TEST FILE SHOULD COVER: \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550 \u2713 Constructor behavior (sets owner, accepts ETH) \u2713 receive() function (plain ETH transfers) \u2713 fallback() function (unknown calls, ETH with data) \u2713 Deposit operations (basic deposit, depositFor, events, edge cases) \u2713 Withdrawal operations (withdraw, withdrawAll, events, edge cases) \u2713 Owner withdrawal (access control, edge cases) \u2713 View functions (getBalance, getContractBalance) \u2713 Function visibility (public, external, internal, private) \u2713 Edge cases (zero values, insufficient balance, zero address) \u2713 Gas measurements (comparing costs of different approaches) \u2713 Fuzz testing (randomized inputs to find unexpected bugs)","kind":"dev","methods":{"setUp()":{"details":"Runs before each test function      Creates fresh contract instance for each test (isolation)"},"testFuzz_Deposit(uint96)":{"details":"Use testFuzz_ prefix, Foundry will generate random uint96 values"},"testFuzz_WithdrawAfterDeposit(uint96,uint96)":{"details":"Deposit random amount, withdraw random amount (within balance)"},"test_CallInternalFunction_Returns()":{"details":"Call wrapper function, verify it calls internal function correctly"},"test_CallPrivateFunction_Returns()":{"details":"Call wrapper function, verify it calls private function correctly"},"test_Constructor_AcceptsETH()":{"details":"Deploy a new contract with ETH using {value: amount} syntax      Then check that the contract's balance equals the amount sent"},"test_Constructor_SetsOwner()":{"details":"Use assertEq to check that functionsContract.owner() equals the owner variable"},"test_DepositFor_CreditsRecipient()":{"details":"User1 deposits for user2, verify user2 gets credit"},"test_DepositFor_RevertsOnZeroAddress()":{"details":"Use vm.expectRevert() to check zero address validation"},"test_Deposit_EmitsEvent()":{"details":"Use vm.expectEmit() to verify event emission"},"test_Deposit_IncreasesBalance()":{"details":"Deposit ETH, then check balance increased"},"test_Deposit_MultipleDeposits()":{"details":"Deposit twice, verify total balance is sum"},"test_Deposit_RevertsOnZeroValue()":{"details":"Use vm.expectRevert() to check that zero value reverts"},"test_ExternalFunction_Returns()":{"details":"Call external function, verify return value"},"test_Fallback_WithData()":{"details":"Call a non-existent function, verify fallback() is triggered"},"test_Fallback_WithETHAndData()":{"details":"Send ETH along with function call data"},"test_Gas_Deposit()":{"details":"Use gasleft() before and after to measure gas"},"test_Gas_Withdraw()":{"details":"Deposit first, then measure withdrawal gas"},"test_GetBalance_ReturnsCorrectBalance()":{"details":"Deposit, then check getBalance() returns correct amount"},"test_GetContractBalance_ReturnsTotalBalance()":{"details":"Multiple deposits, verify total equals sum"},"test_OwnerWithdraw_RevertsIfNotOwner()":{"details":"Use vm.expectRevert() to check access control"},"test_OwnerWithdraw_RevertsOnInsufficientBalance()":{"details":"Use vm.expectRevert() to check insufficient balance validation"},"test_OwnerWithdraw_SendsETHToOwner()":{"details":"Send ETH via receive() (not tracked), then owner withdraws"},"test_PublicFunction_Returns()":{"details":"Call public function, verify return value"},"test_Receive_AcceptsETH()":{"details":"Use vm.prank() to simulate sending from user1      Use vm.expectEmit() to check event emission      Use .call{value:} to send ETH with empty calldata"},"test_Receive_ViaTransfer()":{"details":".transfer() sends ETH with empty calldata, triggering receive()"},"test_WithdrawAll_RevertsOnZeroBalance()":{"details":"Use vm.expectRevert() to check zero balance validation"},"test_WithdrawAll_WithdrawsFullBalance()":{"details":"Deposit, then withdrawAll, verify balance is zero and ETH received"},"test_Withdraw_DecreasesBalance()":{"details":"Deposit first, then withdraw, verify balance decreased and ETH received"},"test_Withdraw_EmitsEvent()":{"details":"Use vm.expectEmit() to verify event emission"},"test_Withdraw_RevertsOnInsufficientBalance()":{"details":"Use vm.expectRevert() to check insufficient balance validation"},"test_Withdraw_RevertsOnZeroAmount()":{"details":"Use vm.expectRevert() to check zero amount validation"}},"title":"FunctionsPayableTest","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"setUp()":{"notice":"\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550                           setUp() FUNCTION \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550 This special function runs BEFORE EACH AND EVERY test function. WHY? Isolation! We want each test to start from a clean slate, like resetting a video game before each level. If Test A modifies the contract and Test B depends on that modification, our tests become fragile and hard to debug. WHAT HAPPENS HERE: 1. We create test addresses (owner, user1, user2) 2. We deploy a FRESH instance of FunctionsPayable 3. We fund test accounts with ETH using vm.deal() 4. We label addresses for better debugging output IMPORTANT: Even if Test A deposits 10 ETH, when Test B runs, setUp() will deploy a brand new contract with 0 balance again. This is GOOD - it prevents tests from interfering with each other!"},"testFuzz_Deposit(uint96)":{"notice":"Fuzz test for deposit with random setUp().details: Runs before each test function      Creates fresh contract instance for each test (isolation)

testFuzz_Deposit(uint96).details: Use testFuzz_ prefix, Foundry will generate random uint96 values

testFuzz_WithdrawAfterDeposit(uint96,uin.details: Deposit random amount, withdraw random amount (within balance)

test_CallInternalFunction_Returns().details: Call wrapper function, verify it calls internal function correctly

test_CallPrivateFunction_Returns().details: Call wrapper function, verify it calls private function correctly

test_Constructor_AcceptsETH().details: Deploy a new contract with ETH using {value: amount} syntax      Then check that the contract's balance equals the amount sent

test_Constructor_SetsOwner().details: Use assertEq to check that functionsContract.owner() equals the owner variable

test_DepositFor_CreditsRecipient().details: User1 deposits for user2, verify user2 gets credit

test_DepositFor_RevertsOnZeroAddress().details: Use vm.expectRevert() to check zero address validation

test_Deposit_EmitsEvent().details: Use vm.expectEmit() to verify event emission

test_Deposit_IncreasesBalance().details: Deposit ETH, then check balance increased

test_Deposit_MultipleDeposits().details: Deposit twice, verify total balance is sum

test_Deposit_RevertsOnZeroValue().details: Use vm.expectRevert() to check that zero value reverts

test_ExternalFunction_Returns().details: Call external function, verify return value

test_Fallback_WithData().details: Call a non-existent function, verify fallback() is triggered

test_Fallback_WithETHAndData().details: Send ETH along with function call data

test_Gas_Deposit().details: Use gasleft() before and after to measure gas

test_Gas_Withdraw().details: Deposit first, then measure withdrawal gas

test_GetBalance_ReturnsCorrectBalance().details: Deposit, then check getBalance() returns correct amount

test_GetContractBalance_ReturnsTotalBala.details: Multiple deposits, verify total equals sum

test_OwnerWithdraw_RevertsIfNotOwner().details: Use vm.expectRevert() to check access control

test_OwnerWithdraw_RevertsOnInsufficient.details: Use vm.expectRevert() to check insufficient balance validation

test_OwnerWithdraw_SendsETHToOwner().details: Send ETH via receive() (not tracked), then owner withdraws

test_PublicFunction_Returns().details: Call public function, verify return value

test_Receive_AcceptsETH().details: Use vm.prank() to simulate sending from user1      Use vm.expectEmit() to check event emission      Use .call{value:} to send ETH with empty calldata

test_Receive_ViaTransfer().details: .transfer() sends ETH with empty calldata, triggering receive()

test_WithdrawAll_RevertsOnZeroBalance().details: Use vm.expectRevert() to check zero balance validation

test_WithdrawAll_WithdrawsFullBalance().details: Deposit, then withdrawAll, verify balance is zero and ETH received

test_Withdraw_DecreasesBalance().details: Deposit first, then withdraw, verify balance decreased and ETH received

test_Withdraw_EmitsEvent().details: Use vm.expectEmit() to verify event emission

test_Withdraw_RevertsOnInsufficientBalan.details: Use vm.expectRevert() to check insufficient balance validation

test_Withdraw_RevertsOnZeroAmount().details: Use vm.expectRevert() to check zero amount validation

setUp().notice: setUp() FUNCTION  This special function runs BEFORE EACH AND EVERY test function. WHY? Isolation! We want each test to start from a clean slate, like resetting a video game before each level. If Test A modifies the contract and Test B depends on that modification, our tests become fragile and hard to debug. WHAT HAPPENS HERE: 1. We create test addresses (owner, user1, user2) 2. We deploy a FRESH instance of FunctionsPayable 3. We fund test accounts with ETH using vm.deal() 4. We label addresses for better debugging output IMPORTANT: Even if Test A deposits 10 ETH, when Test B runs, setUp() will deploy a brand new contract with 0 balance again. This is GOOD - it prevents tests from interfering with each other!

testFuzz_Deposit(uint96).notice: Fuzz test for deposit with random amounts

testFuzz_WithdrawAfterDeposit(uint96,uin.notice: Fuzz test for withdraw after deposit

test_Constructor_SetsOwner().notice: Tests that the constructor correctly sets the owner

test_DepositFor_RevertsOnZeroAddress().notice: Tests that depositFor() reverts on zero address

test_Deposit_EmitsEvent().notice: Tests that deposit() emits Deposited event

test_Deposit_IncreasesBalance().notice: Tests that deposit() increases user balance

test_Deposit_RevertsOnZeroValue().notice: Tests that deposit() reverts on zero value

test_ExternalFunction_Returns().notice: Tests that externalFunction() can be called

test_Fallback_WithData().notice: Tests that fallback() handles unknown function calls

test_OwnerWithdraw_RevertsOnInsufficient.notice: Tests that ownerWithdraw() reverts on insufficient balance

test_PublicFunction_Returns().notice: Tests that publicFunction() can be called

test_Receive_AcceptsETH().notice: Tests that receive() accepts ETH sent via .call

test_Withdraw_DecreasesBalance().notice: Tests that withdraw() decreases balance and sends ETH
